sentence.Network_en: They take me for a dun , peer out from a coign of vantage.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们以为讨债的来了, 就从安全的地方朝外窥伺.

jx.jx_en_mean: a favourable position for observation or action

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: variant of coin. The phrase coign of vantage was first used by Shakespeare (Macbeth i. iv. 7), and later popularized by Sir Walter Scott

means.word_mean: 1. expandable metal or wooden wedge used by printers to lock up a form within a chase
